hackathon-description-text: MakeMIT promotes innovation that is geared towards those who are excited and passionate about designing and building. Over 250 students will participate in an 15+ hour hardware hackathon on February 13, 2016. The top ten teams will be invited to come back for a second weekend in order to refine their design.
hackathon-eligibility: All undergraduate students* are welcome. Though we aren't accepting graduate students as hackers, we would love to have graduate students as event volunteers! Contact us at
hackathon-requirements:
The best hardware hack you can think of, with all the materials in the time frame you're given! See the 2015 winners
Any additional rules will be announced at the hackathon!
hackathon-rules:
All teams and individuals should register by 11:59PM EST on January 29, and the first round of the hackathon will take place on February 13. Those qualifying for the second round will be invited back for the event on February 20.
More detailed rules, schedule and FAQ can be found on 
.
We will abide by the usual 
, as well as all MIT rules and regulations. MakeMIT staff has the final say; that said, please help us make this event enjoyable for everyone!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Finalists from the round 1 hackathon on February 13 who participated in round 2 on February 20!

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Stratton Student Center, 84 Massachusetts Ave, Cambridge, MA 02139, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
- Wow, Awesomeness
- Abnormal techniques
- Creative use of limited re-
sources
- Novel or unique

- Problem-oriented
- Relevant
- Wide audience base
- Useful or entertaining

- Impressive technical achievement
- Robustness, Reliability, Works
- Complexity
